creator: bughunt@gluino.name
text:
On page 

http://jakarta.apache.org/tomcat/tomcat-4.1-doc/config/connectors.html

The link for the "mod_jk" documentation says:

"mod_jk supports load balancing. Enabled by default in 4.1; works in 4.0. See 
<Coyote JK 2>" 

and points to 

http://jakarta.apache.org/tomcat/tomcat-4.1-doc/config/jk2.html

whereas it should be

"mod_jk supports load balancing. Enabled by default in 4.1; works in 4.0. See 
<Coyote JK>" 

and point to

http://jakarta.apache.org/tomcat/tomcat-4.1-doc/config/jk.html

..even if that one *is* deprecated.

creator: remm@apache.org
text: This is incorrect. mod_jk is referring to the native component.

creator: hgomez@apache.org
text:
In fact we should point to :

for jk

http://jakarta.apache.org/builds/jakarta-tomcat-connectors/jk/doc/ 


for jk2 

http://jakarta.apache.org/builds/jakarta-tomcat-connectors/jk2/doc/

Which are up to date since rebuild each night from cvs contents

creator: bughunt@gluino.name
text:
Foo!? Actually I don't think the jk documentation refers to the native
component, the way I see it it refers to both. But please note that
I did not find that page through a link, I found it by guessing the URL,
so it's possibly a leftover from olden time. But thanks for the new links!
(*kiss*)
